column5: Learn how to uncover the secrets of past lives through the study of human and animal skeletons. With this specialist master’s in bioarchaeology, you’ll gain expertise in human anatomy, with unlimited access to our large skeletal collection. You’ll also develop skills in faunal analysis; we have one of the largest reference collections of mammals, birds and fish in the UK.We’re ranked Top 30 in the world for archaeology (QS World University Rankings, 2019).Your specialist bioarcheology learning will cover:
column7: A variety of scholarships, grants and bursaries may be available to help you fund your master’s study.  Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
